datafield.subfield: Meson cloud effects in nucleon resonances at low and intermediate energies
Meson cloud effects in nucleon resonances at low and intermediate energies
Talk presented at EEF70, Workshop on Unquenched Hadron Spectroscopy, 1-5 Sept. 2014, Coimbra
We review some results obtained by the Coimbra-Ljubljana collaboration that reveal the important role of the pion cloud in the low- and intermediate-energy nucleon and delta resonances.
Acta Physica Polonica B Proceedings Supplement, Vol. 8 (2015) 213

00004 The real and the imaginary part of the $T$ matrix in the P11 partial wave (left panel), the renormalized $\pi NR$ coupling constant and the mixing angle $\theta$ as a function of $W$ (middle panels), the quark and the pion contribution to the helicity amplitude $A_{1/2}^p$ in units of $10^{-3}~\mathrm{GeV}^{-1/2}$ calculated in the cloudy bag model using the bag radius of 0.83~fm (right panel).

00008 The scattering $T$ matrix in the S11partial wave (left panel), the renormalized $\pi NN^*$ coupling constants for the two resonance and the mixing angle between the corresponding bare states as a function of $W$ (middle panels).

00005 The real and the imaginary part of the $T$ matrix in the P11 partial wave (left panel), the renormalized $\pi NR$ coupling constant and the mixing angle $\theta$ as a function of $W$ (middle panels), the quark and the pion contribution to the helicity amplitude $A_{1/2}^p$ in units of $10^{-3}~\mathrm{GeV}^{-1/2}$ calculated in the cloudy bag model using the bag radius of 0.83~fm (right panel).

00002 The separate quark and pion contributions to the helicity amplitude $A_{1/2}$ in units of $10^{-3}~\mathrm{GeV}^{-1/2}$ calculated in the linear $\sigma$-model (left panel), the ratio $E2/M1$ (middle panel) and $C2/M1$ (right panel) calculated in the linear $\sigma$-model and in the cromodielectric model.

00001 The separate quark and pion contributions to the helicity amplitude $A_{1/2}$ in units of $10^{-3}~\mathrm{GeV}^{-1/2}$ calculated in the linear $\sigma$-model (left panel), the ratio $E2/M1$ (middle panel) and $C2/M1$ (right panel) calculated in the linear $\sigma$-model and in the cromodielectric model.

00009 The scattering $T$ matrix in the S11partial wave (left panel), the renormalized $\pi NN^*$ coupling constants for the two resonance and the mixing angle between the corresponding bare states as a function of $W$ (middle panels).

00000 The separate quark and pion contributions to the helicity amplitude $A_{1/2}$ in units of $10^{-3}~\mathrm{GeV}^{-1/2}$ calculated in the linear $\sigma$-model (left panel), the ratio $E2/M1$ (middle panel) and $C2/M1$ (right panel) calculated in the linear $\sigma$-model and in the cromodielectric model.
00010 The separate quark and pion contributions to the helicity amplitudes $A_{1/2}$ and $A_{3/2}$ for the $\Delta(1700)$ resonance.
00011 The separate quark and pion contributions to the helicity amplitudes $A_{1/2}$ and $A_{3/2}$ for the $\Delta(1700)$ resonance.
